title: ‘Very sad’ state of affairs: Sky News investigates Victoria crime crisis
description: National Affairs Correspondent Jonathan Lea calls Victoria’s crime crisis a “very sad state” of affairs, which has gone out of control.     ​

title: Fathers ‘patrolling’ streets as Victoria’s crime crisis spirals
description: National Affairs Correspondent Jonathan Lea says some “credit” needs to go to the state government for “recognising” there was a crime crisis in Victoria and now “attempting to move swiftly”.  “The real question here is why it has taken the better part of two years?” Mr Lea told Sky News host Steve Price.  “I feel desperately sorry for ... fathers who are out at night time patrolling suburbs because they feel desperately unsafe.”

title: ‘Sustainable immigration’ is what the UK needs
description: Sky News contributor Adrian Hayes says there are many good reasons for “sustainable immigration”.  Mr Hayes told Sky News host Steve Price that he is not “anti-migration”.  “Sustainable though, the right quality of people, what the country needs.”

title: UK ‘cannot sustain’ the number of illegal migrants
description: Sky News contributor Adrian Hayes says the UK “cannot sustain” the amount of illegal immigration.  Mr Hayes told Sky News host Steve Price that public services will suffer due to the number of illegal migrants.  “It’s got to be a sensible debate.”

title: Keir Starmer’s budget has gone down ‘like a busted lemon’
description: Sky News host Steve Price says Keir Starmer has delivered a budget which won’t boost productivity “at all”.  Mr Price said the budget has gone down “like a busted lemon”.  Sky News contributor Adrian Hayes joined Mr Price to discuss the UK’s budget problems.

title: People will ‘scream racism’ at Donald Trump’s migration crackdown
description: Sky News contributor Adrian Hayes says people will “scream racism” at Donald Trump’s third-world migration crackdown.  US President Donald Trump has announced that migration from third-world countries to be stopped.  Mr Hayes told Sky News host Steve Price that Donald Trump has shown he is not prepared to “cushion” immigrants, causing unsafe US streets.

title: ‘Mad’ bid to remove religion as motivation for terrorist attacks
description: Former Labor MP Michael Danby commends Economist Henry Ergas’ “great service” to “public sanity” by publishing a deconstruction of a proposal to change terror laws, which would remove religion as a motivation for terrorist attacks.  “This should be in your other segment, World’s Gone Mad,” Mr Danby told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “83 of the cases between 2002 and 2024 in his [Henry Ergas] column are reported as being motivated by Islamic fundamentalism.”

title: ​ Reforming terror laws sparks fear of anti-Jewish attacks
description: Former Labor MP Michael Danby commends Economist Henry Ergas, who discusses a bid to reform terror laws that would make the “detection, conviction” and “disruption” of anti-Jewish attacks “almost impossible”.  “If the criteria were taken away as this proposal wants to do, ASIO and AFP would be crippled,”  Mr Danby told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “It's typical of their bias.”

title: Students fight social media ban in the High Court
description: Noah Jones is a 15 year old Australian boy fighting the social media ban legislation in the High Court.  Noah Jones’ mother, Renee Jones, said children's access to social media is a “parenting issue”.  Ms Jones told Sky News host Rowan Dean that it doesn’t require “government intervention”.

title: US Afghanistan withdrawal has ‘come back to haunt them’ after National Guard shooting
description: Sky News host Steve Price says the gunman who killed two National Guards in the US came from Afghanistan after the Biden administration’s withdrawal.  Mr Price said the way the Biden administration handled Afghanistan was a “complete and utter disaster”.  “And some of that’s now come back to haunt them.”

title: Nigel Farage drives ‘spirited debate’ on UK immigration
description: Sky News host Steve Price says there’s a “very spirited debate” about immigration in the UK.  Mr Price said the debate is “largely” driven by Nigel Farage.  “About who does come as a migrant.”

title: ​ ‘Complete nonsense’: Proposal to take religion out of terror laws
description: Liberal Senator Alex Antic does not “understand” why Muslim groups and human rights commissioners are considering taking away religion as a “motivation” for terrorist attacks.  “It's a complete nonsense to try and do this … it's just a sad situation,” Mr Antic told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “This is a growing problem.”

title: ‘Reasonable to debate’: Hanson’s burqa stunt in parliament
description: Liberal Senator Alex Antic discusses One Nation Leader Pauline Hanson’s desire to debate the Burqa.  “It's a fairly new phenomenon that we're now seeing these sorts of breaches with the convention of governments not allowing these bills to pass in the first reading,”  Mr Antic told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “It's quite extraordinary … the bill is something that's quite reasonable to debate.    “The government should have let her.” ​

title: ‘Preserve the safety’: Palestinian family barred from UK
description: Former Labor MP Michael Danby says a UK Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood, has taken actions to “preserve the safety” of British citizens by barring a Palestinian family.  “Western democratic governments have to … protect the public good, which is their primary concern and primary responsibility,” Mr Danby told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “Whoever has come in without proper security clearances needs to be examined properly.”

title: Australia is ‘straining’ under ‘weight’ of increasing immigration numbers
description: Former Labor MP Michael Danby says Australia is “straining under the weight” of immigration numbers.  “This is the next battlefront, and it's something we need to take to the next election,” Mr Antic told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “We need to show the Australian people that's the point of difference between us and the ALP.”
